sub_title: Consultant/Researcher at FSA Research Project 2023: Kenya
summary:
The FSA Research Project is an excellent opportunity to provide answers to your business questions. We deliver tailor made professional consultancy services and research reports for companies with international aspirations.

Each year the project visits a rapidly developing country. The destination of 2023 will be Kenya. As the FSA operates on a non-profit basis, company specific research can be conducted at a competitive price. The quality is guaranteed by years of experience, the careful selection of researchers, seminars and courses from knowledgeable experts, and guidance by leading consultancy firms and the best professors of Amsterdam.

Interested and want to know more? Join the information meeting on Wednesday 9th of November at 8.00 PM by filing in this form:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf_yofM4Jdxqns5SJKN2eMyoJsDqRoc-tsD9nbqGI8waRe-PQ/viewform?usp=sf_link 

Apply now by submitting your resume and a Dutch letter of motivation (max. 500 words) at our website: 
https://fsa.nl/events/research-project-2022-2023/   
Application deadline: 13th of November 2021, 23:59h. 
Fluency in Dutch is required.

More information: visit www.fsaresearchproject.nl or mail rp@fsa.nl

profile_positions.description:
The objective of the FSA Research Project (RP) is to provide students with insight into the world of an international consultant. The group consists of 18 selected, highly motivated students that will work together on various projects over the next eight months. The first challenge for the group is to acquire nine consultancy projects for Dutch companies. Consultancy firms provide several trainings to the students to ensure that the acquisition will be successful. Each duo is then assigned with an appropriate project and will start to prepare for the project with the necessary desk research.

After an exciting acquisition period and thorough desk research, field research in Kenya can start. We will start this period with an opening week, which marks the discovery of Kenya and enables the students to adapt to the local culture, environment and climate. The groups will travel through the country to different locations to conduct their research during five weeks of hard work.

Once the group has returned to the Netherlands, the final stage of the project will start. The results of the research need to be summarized in a report and the report will be presented to the company. Throughout the project, participants will receive multiple training courses from several large consultancy companies.

www.fsaresearchproject.nl

profile_positions.description:
The objective of the FSA Research Project (RP) is to provide students with insight into the world of an international consultant. The group consists of 12 selected, highly motivated students that will work together on various projects over the next eight months. The first challenge for the group is to acquire six consultancy projects for Dutch companies. Consultancy firms provide several trainings to the students to ensure that the acquisition will be successful. Each duo is then assigned with an appropriate project and will start to prepare for the project with the necessary desk research.

After an exciting acquisition period and thorough desk research, field research in Taiwan can start. We will start this period with an opening week, which marks the discovery of Taiwan and enables the students to adapt to the local culture, environment and climate. The groups will travel through the country to different locations to conduct their research during five weeks of hard work.

Once the group has returned to the Netherlands, the final stage of the project will start. The results of the research need to be summarized in a report and the report will be presented to the company. Throughout the project, participants will receive multiple training courses from several large consultancy companies.
